value.title: Scenes from TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
value.content: Thanks to everyone who made this year's San Francisco event what it was -- and to the 10,000 of you who filled the halls, made the connections, and left with more than you came with. Couldn't make it? These images tell part of the story.

value.title: Navan IPO tumbles 20% after historic debut under SEC shutdown workaround
value.content: Navan finished its first day trading at an approximate valuation of $4.7 billion, which is about half of its last private valuation of $9.2 billion.

value.title: Nvidia is reportedly investing up to $1B in Poolside
value.content: Nvidia is an existing investor in the AI company and participated in its $500 million Series A round in 2024.

value.title: Canva launches its own design model, adds new AI features to the platform
value.content: Canva is launching new features like Forms and email design, and it makes Affinity free for all users.

value.title: Bevel raises $10M Series A from General Catalyst for its AI health companion
value.content: Bevel's AI health companion unifies data from wearables and daily habits across sleep, fitness, and nutrition into personalized insights.

value.title: Threads now lets you approve and filter your replies
value.content: While Threads already offers tools that let you limit replies to people you follow, your followers, or people you mention, the new feature allows you to keep your replies open to all without the negative consequences of having discussions derailed.

value.title: Google partners with Ambani’s Reliance to offer free AI Pro access to millions of Jio users in India
value.content: U.S. tech giants increasingly view India as the next big frontier — a place to gather diverse data, refine models, and test AI use cases that could later scale across other emerging markets.

value.title: Figma acquires AI-powered media generation company Weavy
value.content: Figma said that Weavy will exist as a stand-alone product for now and that, in the future, it will be integrated with the Figma Weave brand, along with the rest of the Figma platform.

value.title: The Prompting Company snags $6.5M to help products get mentioned in ChatGPT and other AI apps
value.content: Retailers could see up to a 520% increase in traffic from chatbots and AI prompts in 2025 compared to 2024, according to the report. For brands, that means figuring out how to show up in AI-generated recommendations, and fast.

value.title: WhatsApp adds passkey protection to end-to-end encrypted backups
value.content: This means if you lose your device, you can use methods like fingerprint, face, or the screen lock code of your previous device to access WhatsApp's backup.

value.title: IntrCity SmartBus lands $30M at $140M valuation to deepen its grip on India’s intercity travel market
value.content: IntrCity SmartBus grew revenue by 67% last year and is targeting full profitability this year, as intercity travel booms across India.

value.title: India’s Snabbit valuation doubled to $180M in 5 months on its quick house-help bet
value.content: India's appetite for instant convenience — once confined to food and grocery delivery — is expanding into house help.

value.title: Cluely’s Roy Lee on the rage-bait strategy for startup marketing
value.content: Cluely's Roy Lee has a message for startup founders: You should be thinking harder about how to go viral.

value.title: NBA champion Tristan Thompson and World Mobile launch community-owned network Uplift
value.content: With Uplift, every subscription will contribute to neighborhood-level network expansion, while local hosts that are known as "AirNode operators" will earn a portion of network revenue by providing community coverage.

value.title: Digg founder Kevin Rose on the need for trusted social communities in the AI era
value.content: Now again under Rose's control, the new Digg is creating a place for people to socialize and connect online within communities, similar to Reddit, but it has different ideas about how such a platform should work at a time when bots are nearly indistinguishable from humans.

value.title: YouTube announces ‘voluntary exit program’ for US staff
value.content: YouTube CEO Neal Mohan told employees about the program via an internal memo on Wednesday.

value.title: And the winner of Startup Battlefield at Disrupt 2025 is: Glīd
value.content: Glīd, which is trying to streamline cargo container logistics, has beaten out 199 other Startup Battlefield companies to take home $100,000.

value.title: Solana co-founder Anatoly Yakovenko is a big fan of agentic coding
value.content: Speaking at TechCrunch Disrupt, Yakovenko said he's become increasingly comfortable taking a back seat in software development tasks.

value.title: 2024’s Startup Battlefield runner-up geCKo Materials reveals four new products at TechCrunch Disrupt
value.content: geCKo Materials returned to the stage at TechCrunch Disrupt to debut new products as it pushes deeper into commercializing its tech.

value.title: Box CEO Aaron Levie on how AI is changing the enterprise SaaS landscape
value.content: He painted a picture of a future of enterprise software where the SaaS is used for the core business workflow, and then the agents ride on top of that.
